Description: Fragmentary medium-sized jar carved from calcite; with flat base and flaring sides, becoming convex at shoulder, flat ledge-rim; one pierced tubular handle remains at shoulder level; polished surface; partially reconstructed; cracked rim.
Curator's comments: Shouldered jar with tubular handles were produced during the Predynastic and Early Dynastic periods (Aston 1994, 92 no. 5 and 121 no. 79-81). Considering the very early type of this calcite vessel, it is dubious that it comes from Naukratis. It could also be a thesaurised reused vessel. Aston, B. G. 1994, Ancient Egyptian stone vessels: materials and forms, Heidelberg.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (EA.164) (phase 3)
